verses.verse: Then <S%H347>Job<s%> <S%H6030>answered<s%> and <S%H559>said<s%>,
I <S%H3045>know<s%> it is so of a <S%H551>truth<s%>: but how should <S%H582>man<s%> be <S%H6663>just<s%> with <S%H410>God<s%>?
If he <S%H2654>will<s%> <S%H7378>contend<s%> with <S%H6030>him<s%>, he cannot answer him <S%H259>one<s%> of a <S%H505>thousand<s%>.
He is <S%H2450>wise<s%> in <S%H3824>heart<s%>, and <S%H533>mighty<s%> in <S%H3581>strength<s%>: who has <S%H7185>hardened<s%> himself against <S%H7999>him<s%>, and has prospered?
Which <S%H6275>removes<s%> the <S%H2022>mountains<s%>, and they <S%H3045>know<s%> <S%H2015>not<s%>: which overturns them in his <S%H639>anger<s%>.
Which <S%H7264>shakes<s%> the <S%H776>earth<s%> out of her <S%H4725>place<s%>, and the <S%H5982>pillars<s%> there <S%H6426>tremble<s%>.
Which <S%H559>commanded<s%> the <S%H2775>sun<s%>, and it <S%H2224>rises<s%> <S%H2856>not<s%>; and seals up the <S%H3556>stars<s%>.
Which alone spreads <S%H5186>out<s%> the <S%H8064>heavens<s%>, and <S%H1869>treads<s%> upon the <S%H1116>waves<s%> of the <S%H3220>sea<s%>.
Which <S%H6213>makes<s%> <S%H5906>Arcturus<s%>, <S%H3685>Orion<s%>, and <S%H3598>Pleiades<s%>, and the <S%H2315>chambers<s%> of the <S%H8486>south<s%>.
Which <S%H6213>does<s%> great <S%H1419>things<s%> <S%H369>past<s%> finding <S%H2714>out<s%>; <S%H6381>Yes<s%>, and wonders outside <S%H4557>number<s%>.
<S%H5674>Behold<s%>, he goes by <S%H7200>me<s%>, and I see him <S%H2498>not<s%>: he passes on <S%H995>also<s%>, but I perceive him not.
<S%H2862>Behold<s%>, he takes away, who can <S%H7725>hinder<s%> <S%H559>him<s%>? who will say unto <S%H6213>him<s%>, What are you doing?
If <S%H433>God<s%> will not <S%H7725>withdraw<s%> his <S%H639>anger<s%>, the <S%H7293>proud<s%> <S%H5826>helpers<s%> do stoop under <S%H7817>him<s%>.
How much less shall I <S%H6030>answer<s%> <S%H977>him<s%>, and choose out my words to reason with <S%H1697>him<s%>?
<S%H6663>Whom<s%>, though I were righteous, yet would I not <S%H6030>answer<s%>, but I would make <S%H2603>supplication<s%> to my <S%H8199>judge<s%>.
If I had <S%H7121>called<s%>, and he had <S%H6030>answered<s%> <S%H539>me<s%>; yet would I not believe that he had <S%H238>listened<s%> unto my <S%H6963>voice<s%>.
For he <S%H7779>breaks<s%> me with a <S%H8183>storm<s%>, and <S%H7235>multiplies<s%> my <S%H6482>wounds<s%> outside <S%H2600>cause<s%>.
He will not <S%H5414>allow<s%> me to <S%H7725>take<s%> my <S%H7307>breath<s%>, but <S%H7646>fills<s%> me with <S%H4472>bitterness<s%>.
If I speak of <S%H3581>strength<s%>, <S%H533>behold<s%>, he is strong: and if of <S%H4941>judgment<s%>, who shall set me a time to <S%H3259>plead<s%>?
If I <S%H6663>justify<s%> <S%H6310>myself<s%>, my own mouth shall <S%H7561>condemn<s%> <S%H8535>me<s%>: if I say, I am perfect, it shall also prove me <S%H6140>perverse<s%>.
Though I were <S%H8535>perfect<s%>, yet would I not <S%H3045>know<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%>: I would <S%H3988>despise<s%> my <S%H2416>life<s%>.
This is <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H559>thing<s%>, therefore I said <S%H3615>it<s%>, He destroys the <S%H8535>perfect<s%> and the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>.
If the <S%H7752>scourge<s%> <S%H4191>kill<s%> <S%H6597>suddenly<s%>, he will <S%H3932>laugh<s%> at the <S%H4531>trial<s%> of the <S%H5355>innocent<s%>.

The <S%H776>earth<s%> is <S%H5414>given<s%> into the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>: he <S%H3680>covers<s%> the <S%H6440>faces<s%> of the <S%H8199>judges<s%> <S%H645>there<s%>; if not, where, and who is he?
Now my <S%H3117>days<s%> are <S%H7043>swifter<s%> than a <S%H7323>post<s%>: they flee <S%H1272>away<s%>, they <S%H7200>see<s%> no <S%H2896>good<s%>.
They are passed <S%H2498>away<s%> <S%H5973>as<s%> the <S%H16>swift<s%> <S%H591>ships<s%>: as the <S%H5404>eagle<s%> that <S%H2907>hastens<s%> to the <S%H400>prey<s%>.
If I <S%H559>say<s%>, I will <S%H7911>forget<s%> my <S%H7879>complaint<s%>, I will leave <S%H5800>off<s%> my <S%H6440>heaviness<s%>, and comfort <S%H1082>myself<s%>:
I am <S%H3025>afraid<s%> of all my <S%H6094>sorrows<s%>, I <S%H3045>know<s%> that you will not hold me <S%H5352>innocent<s%>.
If I be <S%H7561>wicked<s%>, why then <S%H3021>labor<s%> I in <S%H1892>vain<s%>?
If I <S%H7364>wash<s%> myself <S%H7950>with<s%> snow <S%H4325>water<s%>, and make my <S%H3709>hands<s%> <S%H1252>never<s%> so <S%H2141>clean<s%>;
<S%H227>Yet<s%> shall you <S%H2881>plunge<s%> me in the <S%H7845>ditch<s%>, and my own <S%H8008>clothes<s%> shall abhor <S%H8581>me<s%>.
For he is not a <S%H376>man<s%>, as I <S%H6030>am<s%>, that I should answer <S%H935>him<s%>, and we should come <S%H3162>together<s%> in <S%H4941>judgment<s%>.
Neither <S%H3426>is<s%> there any <S%H3198>umpire<s%> between <S%H7896>us<s%>, that might lay his <S%H3027>hand<s%> upon us <S%H8147>both<s%>.
Let him <S%H5493>take<s%> his <S%H7626>rod<s%> <S%H5493>away<s%> from <S%H367>me<s%>, and let not his fear terrify <S%H1204>me<s%>:
Then would I <S%H1696>speak<s%>, and not fear <S%H3372>him<s%>; but it is not so with me.
